013package org.apache.juneau.html.annotation;
014
015import static java.lang.annotation.ElementType.*;
016import static java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy.*;
017
018import java.lang.annotation.*;
019
020import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.html.*;
022
023/**
024 * Annotation that can be applied to classes, fields, and methods to tweak how they are handled by {@link HtmlSerializer}.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Can be used in the following locations:
028 * <ul>
029 *    <li>Marshalled classes/methods/fields.
030 *    <li><ja>@Rest</ja>-annotated classes and <ja>@RestOp</ja>-annotated methods when an {@link #on()} value is specified.
031 * </ul>
032 *
033 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
034 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/HtmlAnnotation">@Html Annotation</a>
035 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/HtmlBasics">HTML Details</a>
036 * </ul>
037 */
038@Documented
039@Target({TYPE,FIELD,METHOD})
040@Retention(RUNTIME)
041@Inherited
042@Repeatable(HtmlAnnotation.Array.class)
043@ContextApply(HtmlAnnotation.Apply.class)
044public @interface Html {
045
046   /**
047    * Use the specified anchor text when serializing a URI.
048    *
049    * <p>
050    * The text can contain any bean property values resolved through variables of the form <js>"{property-name}"</js>.
051    *
052    * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
053    * <p class='bjava'>
054    *    <jc>// Produces &lt;a href&#61;'...'&gt;drive&lt;/a&gt; when serialized to HTML.</jc>
055    *    <ja>@Html</ja>(anchorText=<js>"drive"</js>)
056    *    <ja>@URI</ja> <jc>// Treat property as a URL</jc>
057    *    <jk>public</jk> String getDrive() {...}
058    * </p>
059    *
060    * <p>
061    * This overrides the behavior specified by {@link org.apache.juneau.html.HtmlSerializer.Builder#uriAnchorText(AnchorText)}.
062    *
063    * @return The annotation value.
064    */
065   String anchorText() default "";
066
067    /**
068     * Optional description for the exposed API.
069     *
070     * @return The annotation value.
071     * @since 9.2.0
072     */
073    String[] description() default {};
074
075    /**
076    * Specifies what format to use for the HTML element.
077    *
078    * @return The annotation value.
079    */
080   HtmlFormat format() default HtmlFormat.HTML;
081
082   /**
083    * Adds a hyperlink to a bean property when rendered as HTML.
084    *
085    * <p>
086    * The text can contain any bean property values resolved through variables of the form <js>"{property-name}"</js>.
087    *
088    * <p>
089    * The URLs can be any of the following forms:
090    * <ul>
091    *    <li>Absolute - e.g. <js>"http://host:123/myContext/myServlet/myPath"</js>
092    *    <li>Context-root-relative - e.g. <js>"/myContext/myServlet/myPath"</js>
093    *    <li>Context-relative - e.g. <js>"context:/myServlet/myPath"</js>
094    *    <li>Servlet-relative - e.g. <js>"servlet:/myPath"</js>
095    *    <li>Path-info-relative - e.g. <js>"myPath"</js>
096    * </ul>
097    *
098    * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
099    * <p class='bjava'>
100    *    <jk>public class</jk> FileSpace {
101    *
102    *       <ja>@Html</ja>(link=<js>"servlet:/drive/{drive}"</js>)
103    *       <jk>public</jk> String getDrive() {
104    *          ...;
105    *       }
106    *    }
107    * </p>
108    *
109    * @return The annotation value.
110    */
111   String link() default "";
112
113   /**
114    * When <jk>true</jk>, don't add headers to tables.
115    *
116    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
117    *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.html.HtmlSerializer.Builder#addKeyValueTableHeaders()}
118    * </ul>
119    *
120    * @return The annotation value.
121    */
122   boolean noTableHeaders() default false;
123
124   /**
125    * When <jk>true</jk>, collections of beans should be rendered as trees instead of tables.
126    *
127    * <p>
128    * Default is <jk>false</jk>.
129    *
130    * @return The annotation value.
131    */
132   boolean noTables() default false;
133
134   /**
135    * Dynamically apply this annotation to the specified classes/methods/fields.
136    *
137    * <p>
138    * Used in conjunction with {@link org.apache.juneau.BeanContext.Builder#applyAnnotations(Class...)} to dynamically apply an annotation to an existing class/method/field.
139    * It is ignored when the annotation is applied directly to classes/methods/fields.
140    *
141    * <h5 class='section'>Valid patterns:</h5>
142    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
143    *  <li>Classes:
144    *       <ul>
145    *          <li>Fully qualified:
146    *             <ul>
147    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass"</js>
148    *             </ul>
149    *          <li>Fully qualified inner class:
150    *             <ul>
151    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
152    *             </ul>
153    *          <li>Simple:
154    *             <ul>
155    *                <li><js>"MyClass"</js>
156    *             </ul>
157    *          <li>Simple inner:
158    *             <ul>
159    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
160    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2"</js>
161    *                <li><js>"Inner2"</js>
162    *             </ul>
163    *       </ul>
164    *    <li>Methods:
165    *       <ul>
166    *          <li>Fully qualified with args:
167    *             <ul>
168    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
169    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
170    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
171    *             </ul>
172    *          <li>Fully qualified:
173    *             <ul>
174    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod"</js>
175    *             </ul>
176    *          <li>Simple with args:
177    *             <ul>
178    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
179    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
180    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
181    *             </ul>
182    *          <li>Simple:
183    *             <ul>
184    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod"</js>
185    *             </ul>
186    *          <li>Simple inner class:
187    *             <ul>
188    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
189    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
190    *                <li><js>"Inner2.myMethod"</js>
191    *             </ul>
192    *       </ul>
193    *    <li>Fields:
194    *       <ul>
195    *          <li>Fully qualified:
196    *             <ul>
197    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myField"</js>
198    *             </ul>
199    *          <li>Simple:
200    *             <ul>
201    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myField"</js>
202    *             </ul>
203    *          <li>Simple inner class:
204    *             <ul>
205    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
206    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
207    *                <li><js>"Inner2.myField"</js>
208    *             </ul>
209    *       </ul>
210    *    <li>A comma-delimited list of anything on this list.
211    * </ul>
212    *
213    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
214    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/DynamicallyAppliedAnnotations">Dynamically Applied Annotations</a>
215    * </ul>
216    *
217    * @return The annotation value.
218    */
219   String[] on() default {};
220
221   /**
222    * Dynamically apply this annotation to the specified classes.
223    *
224    * <p>
225    * Identical to {@link #on()} except allows you to specify class objects instead of a strings.
226    *
227    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
228    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/DynamicallyAppliedAnnotations">Dynamically Applied Annotations</a>
229    * </ul>
230    *
231    * @return The annotation value.
232    */
233   Class<?>[] onClass() default {};
234
235   /**
236    * Associates an {@link HtmlRender} with a bean property for custom HTML rendering of the property.
237    *
238    * <p>
239    * This annotation applies to bean properties and classes.
240    *
241    * @return The annotation value.
242    */
243   @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
244   Class<? extends HtmlRender> render() default HtmlRender.class;
245}
